titleStmt.title: Londons love to her neighbours in generall and in particular to the six associated counties, namely Norfolk, Suffolk, Essex, Cambridge, Hartford, and Bedford. Wherein is plainly laid open the danger which is like immediately to fall upon them, uulesse [sic] they with firm resolution stand to their armes to withstand the blood-thirsty cavaliers.
titleStmt.author: Williams, John, Captain.

notesStmt.note: Anonymous; attributed to John Williams by Wing.
With title page woodcut, bearing caption: Parliament for religion, lawes, and liberties wee'l strive, commonalty with heart and hand, and purse, whilst we remaine alive.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
